prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in elementary school would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in elementary school would. What is the greatest possible number of digits in the product of a 4-digit whole number and a 3-digit whole number?
solution: The greatest product of a 4-digit whole number and a 3-digit whole number is $(10^4-1)(10^3-1)=10^7-10^4-10^3+1=10^7-(10^4+10^3-1)$. $10^7$ has 8 digits and $10^4+10^3-1=11,000-1=10,999$ has 5 digits. Clearly, their difference (10,000,000-10,999) has $8-1=\boxed{7}$ digits.
gpt_response:
To find the greatest possible number of digits in the product of a 4-digit whole number and a 3-digit whole number, we need to multiply the highest 4-digit number (9999) by the highest 3-digit number (999).

9999 x 999 = 9,989,001

So, the product of a 4-digit whole number and a 3-digit whole number can have up to 7 digits.
solution_prompt:
